hero.title: Nearshoring Industriel à Baja
hero.subtitle: La porte d'entrée principale pour les fabricants américains qui s'étendent au Mexique. Accès à une infrastructure de classe mondiale et à une main-d'œuvre qualifiée à seulement 20 minutes de San Diego.

services.title: Solutions Nearshore Complètes
services.subtitle: Nous simplifions votre expansion au Mexique avec des services de soutien industriel de bout en bout.
services.real_estate_desc: Trouvez des bâtiments industriels de classe A, des entrepôts et des terrains à vendre ou à louer dans les meilleurs parcs industriels de Baja California.
services.shelter_desc: Lancez vos opérations en seulement 90 jours. Nous gérons les RH, le juridique, l'import/export et la conformité.
services.contract_desc: Associez-vous à des maquiladoras établies pour la fabrication électronique, de dispositifs médicaux et aérospatiale.
services.logistics_desc: Solutions stratégiques 3PL et de cross-docking près des ports d'entrée d'Otay Mesa et San Ysidro.
services.call_center_desc: Développez votre support avec plus de 50 000 agents bilingues dans le fuseau horaire du Pacifique.

footer.description: Votre partenaire de confiance pour le nearshoring industriel, les services shelter et la fabrication à Baja California, Mexique.

howWeWork.title: Votre Chemin vers la Production
howWeWork.subtitle: Un processus éprouvé pour établir efficacement vos opérations mexicaines.
howWeWork.step1_desc: Nous analysons les besoins de votre projet, de la superficie aux besoins en main-d'œuvre.
howWeWork.step2_desc: Visites guidées des parcs industriels et des partenaires shelter potentiels à Baja California.
howWeWork.step3_desc: Finaliser les contrats, obtenir les permis et commencer vos opérations de fabrication.

about.title: À propos de Nearshore Navigator
about.subtitle: Votre partenaire de confiance pour l'expansion industrielle au Mexique
about.mission: Nous aidons les entreprises américaines à établir des opérations de fabrication réussies à Baja California, Mexique.
about.expertise: Notre équipe réunit une expertise en immobilier industriel, droit du travail mexicain, conformité douanière et opérations de fabrication.
about.team: Basée à San Diego et Baja California, notre équipe bilingue comprend les nuances des affaires des deux côtés de la frontière.
about.founderQuote: Mon expérience comprend des travaux de leadership dans des environnements d'entrée sur le marché — où l'exécution, les délais et les détails opérationnels comptent.
about.founderTitle: Conseils experts en nearshoring pour Baja California
about.founderDescription: Nous aidons les entreprises manufacturières à s'étendre à Baja California avec un processus clair et une connaissance du marché local.
about.founderStat1: Plus de 15 ans de soutien à l'expansion manufacturière transfrontalière
about.founderStat2: Soutien à la création de plus de 20 entreprises au Mexique
about.founderStat3: Soutien pratique de l'évaluation au lancement
about.heroSubtitle: Built for manufacturers entering Baja California. We provide structured guidance, practical options, and the right introductions so your expansion doesn’t stall in uncertainty.
about.softLandingDesc: For when speed matters. We help you assess the most efficient entry route (Shelter, M&A, or standalone) and connect you with vetted options.

privacy.section4_text: Nous mettons en œuvre des mesures techniques et organisationnelles appropriées pour protéger vos informations personnelles.
privacy.section5_text: Nous utilisons des cookies et des technologies similaires pour améliorer votre expérience sur notre site.

resources.title: Industrial Resources & Tools
resources.subtitle: Essential calculators, maps, and guides for your Mexico expansion.
resources.latestIntelligenceDesc: Analyses d'experts et guides stratégiques pour vous aider à naviguer dans le paysage du nearshoring.

brochure.title: Nearshore Navigator
brochure.subtitle: Your Strategic Partner for Manufacturing in Baja California
brochure.proximityDesc: Just 20 minutes from San Diego, enabling executive oversight and JIT logistics.
brochure.laborDesc: Access to over 700,000 manufacturing workers with aerospace, medical device, and electronics experience.
brochure.infrastructureDesc: Over 70 industrial parks with Class A buildings, high-speed fiber, and reliable utilities.

assessment.costModelingDesc: Detailed comparison of labor, real-time CFE electricity, and lease rates vs. your current operations.

distributionPage.heroSubtitle: Optimize your supply chain with cross-border fulfillment and 3PL solutions at the busiest land port of entry in the Western Hemisphere.
distributionPage.sameDayDesc: Reach 40 million consumers in Southern California within hours.
distributionPage.section321Desc: Ship duty-free to US consumers on orders under $800.
distributionPage.portsDesc: Otay Mesa and San Ysidro crossings for flexible routing.
distributionPage.transloadingDesc: Switch containers between rail, truck, and air seamlessly.
distributionPage.strategicText1: Baja California is adjacent to San Diego, providing immediate access to the US Interstate highway system (I-5 and I-805). The Otay Mesa Commercial Port of Entry processes over $50 billion in trade annually, making it the busiest commercial crossing on the California-Mexico border.
distributionPage.strategicText2: For e-commerce brands targeting the US West Coast market, Baja California acts as the perfect fulfillment hub — combining Mexican labor cost advantages with same-day delivery capabilities to Southern California.
distributionPage.faq1Question: What is Section 321 and how does it benefit e-commerce?
distributionPage.faq1Answer: Section 321 is a US customs provision that allows duty-free import of goods valued under $800 per recipient per day. By shipping from a Baja California fulfillment center directly to US consumers, e-commerce brands can avoid import duties entirely on qualifying orders.
distributionPage.faq2Question: How long does it take to cross the border?
distributionPage.faq2Answer: FAST-lane enabled carriers with C-TPAT certification can cross in under 30 minutes during off-peak hours. Standard commercial crossings average 1-2 hours. We work with 3PL partners that have priority crossing privileges.
distributionPage.faq3Question: Can you handle cold chain / temperature-controlled goods?
distributionPage.faq3Answer: Yes. Several of our 3PL partners offer temperature-controlled warehousing and transportation for food, pharmaceuticals, and other perishable goods requiring cold chain integrity.
distributionPage.guideDesc: Save up to 25% on tariffs by fulfilling US orders from Tijuana.
distributionPage.questionnaireDesc: Complete our 36-point operational questionnaire to receive a customized logistics proposal.
distributionPage.formSubtitle: Connect with vetted 3PL and distribution partners in Baja California.

contractPage.heroSubtitle: Don't want to run a factory? Partner with established manufacturers in Baja California who already have the equipment, certifications, and trained workforce.
contractPage.establishedDesc: Skip the 2-year ramp-up. Partner with manufacturers already running production.
contractPage.ipDesc: NDA-first approach. Contract manufacturers handle production, you own the designs.
contractPage.certifiedDesc: We match you with CMs that already hold your required industry certifications.
contractPage.workforceDesc: Baja California has 700,000+ manufacturing workers with decades of export experience.
contractPage.medicalDesc: Clean room assembly (ISO Class 7/8) for Class I, II, and III devices. ISO 13485 certified.
contractPage.electronicsDesc: PCB assembly, SMT lines, wire harness, and consumer electronics manufacturing.
contractPage.aerospaceDesc: Precision components, sub-assemblies, and MRO services for commercial and defense.
contractPage.automotiveDesc: Sub-assembly, upholstery, injection molding, and wire harness for OEMs and Tier 1/2 suppliers.
contractPage.step1Desc: Share your product specs, volume needs, quality standards, and certification requirements.
contractPage.step2Desc: We curate 3-5 contract manufacturers that match your criteria, all pre-vetted.
contractPage.step3Desc: Tour facilities, meet management, assess capabilities, and review quality systems.
contractPage.step4Desc: We assist with contract terms, pricing negotiation, and production ramp-up.
contractPage.faq1Question: What minimum order volumes do CMs require?
contractPage.faq1Answer: This varies by industry and complexity. Medical device CMs often start at $500K-$1M annual spend. Electronics CMs may accept lower volumes for high-mix products. We match you with partners suited to your scale.
contractPage.faq2Answer: All relationships begin with NDAs. Mexican IP law is USMCA-aligned, providing strong protections. We recommend registering patents/trademarks in Mexico as well. CMs typically sign non-compete clauses for your product category.
contractPage.faq3Question: Can I audit the factory before committing?
contractPage.faq3Answer: Absolutely. We encourage and facilitate site visits. Most clients conduct 1-2 day audits covering quality systems, production capabilities, workforce, and financial stability before making a decision.
contractPage.faq4Question: What certifications should I look for?
contractPage.faq4Answer: Medical: ISO 13485, FDA Registration. Automotive: IATF 16949. Aerospace: AS9100D, NADCAP. Electronics: IPC-A-610, ISO 9001. We only match you with CMs holding your required certifications.
contractPage.formSubtitle: Tell us your product, volume, and certification requirements. We'll curate 3-5 pre-vetted contract manufacturers.
contractPage.strategySubtitle: We move beyond simple introductions. We meticulously vet suppliers and protect your IP to de-risk your entry into Mexico.
contractPage.capabilityDesc: Deep-dive surveys into engineering, quality systems, and financial health—not just a name and a website.
contractPage.roadmapDesc: Plan your 'de-risking' strategy: Start with a contract partner, then transition to your own facility as you scale.
contractPage.safeguardsDesc: We act as your local eyes and ears, managing pricing, pilot runs, and routine audits to ensure US standards.

realEstatePage.heroSubtitle: Secure the perfect industrial space for your manufacturing or logistics operation in Mexico's top border city.
realEstatePage.premiumText1: Baja California offers over 70 million square feet of industrial inventory. Whether you need a 20,000 sq. ft. light assembly facility or a 200,000 sq. ft. distribution center, we help you navigate the market to find the right property.
realEstatePage.premiumText2: We have relationships with all major industrial developers in the region, including Vesta, Prologis, and local groups, ensuring you get access to both on-market and off-market opportunities.
realEstatePage.faq1Question: What are the current lease rates?
realEstatePage.faq1Answer: Lease rates in Baja California typically range from $0.75 to $0.95 USD per sq. ft. per month (NNN), depending on location and building class.
realEstatePage.faq2Question: What is the typical lease term?
realEstatePage.faq2Answer: Standard industrial lease terms are usually 3 to 5 years, though longer terms (7-10 years) may be required for built-to-suit projects.
realEstatePage.formSubtitle: Tell us your requirements and we'll send you a curated list of available properties.
realEstatePage.strategySubtitle: More than just finding a building. We perform technical audits and comparative studies to ensure your site supports your long-term operation.
realEstatePage.utilityDesc: We verify substation capacity and water availability before you sign, mitigating the risk of utility shortages.
realEstatePage.comparativeDesc: TCO analysis comparing Baja California vs. Bajío or other regions to quantify your total landed cost.
realEstatePage.tenantDesc: Expert advice on Build-to-Suit vs. Existing Inventory to maximize leverage in a low-vacancy market.

callCenterPage.heroSubtitle: Scale your customer support operations with Baja California's world-class bilingual workforce at a fraction of US costs.
callCenterPage.costSavingsDesc: Reduce operational costs compared to US-based call centers while maintaining quality.
callCenterPage.agentsDesc: Access a deep talent pool of English and Spanish speaking professionals.
callCenterPage.timezoneDesc: Same working hours as California for real-time collaboration and oversight.
callCenterPage.cultureDesc: Agents familiar with US culture and customer expectations.
callCenterPage.glanceTitle: Baja California BPO at a Glance
callCenterPage.formSubtitle: Tell us about your support needs and we'll connect you with vetted call center partners.

s321.heroSubtitle: Navigate the 2025 de minimis suspension and discover compliant Section 321 distribution strategies in Mexico.
s321.whatIsDesc: Section 321 has historically been a massive advantage for e-commerce. However, recent US Customs suspensions have changed the rules. Understanding the pivot to IMMEX and Bonded strategies is now mandatory for cost-effective fulfillment.
s321.suspensionDesc: CBP has fully suspended Section 321 de minimis for commercial shipments. All B2C entries now require full customs processing, making 'Alternative Routing' the new standard.
s321.pivotDesc: Utilize Mexico's IMMEX program to defer duties and manage consolidated container entries effectively.
s321.complianceDesc: Ensure your supply chain remains compliant with the new Type 86 restrictions and USMCA 2026 protocols.
s321.whyBaja1: 20 Minutes from San Diego border crossings
s321.whyBaja2: Access to low-cost, high-quality Mexican logistics labor
s321.whyBaja3: Same-day injection into the US domestic shipping system
s321.whyBaja4: Significant savings on returns processing and reverse logistics
s321.step1Desc: Your goods arrive at the Port of Ensenada or Port of Long Beach in 'Bonded' status.
s321.step2Desc: Kitting, labeling, and storage in a world-class Tijuana facility without paying duties.
s321.step3Desc: B2C orders are prepared as consolidated entries under new regulatory protocols.
s321.step4Desc: Processed via specialized lanes and handed over to US carriers in San Diego.
s321.formSubtitle: Schedule a call to discuss your 2026 de minimis strategy and alternative routing.

broker.advisorDesc: We don't own the buildings; we navigate the market to find you the perfect fit.
broker.matchmakingDesc: Connecting you with vetted CMs and shelter providers based on performance data.
broker.networkDesc: Direct access to 70+ industrial parks and top-tier logistics operators.

questionnaire.title: 3PL Operation Questionnaire
questionnaire.subtitle: Confidential Assessment
questionnaire.intro: Please provide the following information to help us understand your operation requirements.
questionnaire.q1: How many square feet do you need for your operation?
questionnaire.q2: What kind of products would you be moving with us?
questionnaire.q3: What is the presentation of the product we will be receiving? (standard pallets, bulk, bags, packages, etc.)
questionnaire.q4: Please provide the dimensions in inches of the packages or pallets we will be receiving (length, width, height).
questionnaire.q5: What is the average weight in pounds of the pallets?
questionnaire.q6: What are the tariff fractions of the products we would be storing?
questionnaire.q7: Are any of the products Hazmat?
questionnaire.q8: How many levels can the pallets be stacked one on top of the other?
questionnaire.q9: How many orders are we going to process per day?
questionnaire.q10: How many pieces does a typical order consist of?
questionnaire.q11: Are we going to do virtual transfers or are we going to do home extension?
questionnaire.q12: Explain the process you need to be carried out within the Distribution Center. (Attach diagram/doc if needed)
questionnaire.q13: How will you transmit the orders to us?
questionnaire.q14: What is the order management system you use?
questionnaire.q15: How often would you be transmitting the orders to us?
questionnaire.q16: What would be the order transmission protocol? (AS2, FTP, SFTP, Mail, OTHER)
questionnaire.q17: What will be the content of the transmission? (EDI ANSI X12, PLAIN TEXT CSV/TAB/PIPE)
questionnaire.q18: Please provide an example of the commands you would transmit to us for testing.
questionnaire.q19: Do you have an estimate of the number of personnel required?
questionnaire.q20: Do you have an estimate of the number of pallets positions to store?
questionnaire.q21: How many trailer loads will we receive per week?
questionnaire.q22: How many pallets will fit in each trailer load?
questionnaire.q23: How many orders or units will we be shipping per day?
questionnaire.q24: Are there any current operations we can visit?
questionnaire.q25: How many part numbers go on an average order?
questionnaire.q26: How many SKU's do you handle in total? (Attach catalog if possible)
questionnaire.q27: How many units/cartons fit on a standard 40"x48"x60" pallet?
questionnaire.q28: Do you need special equipment? (sewing machines, cutting machines, etc.)
questionnaire.q29: What are the destinations we would be shipping to?
questionnaire.q30: What is the company that owns the merchandise?
questionnaire.q31: Which company would we bill for our services?
questionnaire.q32: What would be the total value of the merchandise to be held?
questionnaire.q33: Do you agree to extend your policy to insure the merchandise?
questionnaire.q34: What is the period for which you require our services?
questionnaire.q35: Can we offer you quotes for transportation? What are the addresses?
questionnaire.q36: What Annex 24 system do you use?
